ngoList.title: Madhu Murchhana
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: FIRST EVER ORGANISATION TO HOLD A MUSICAL CONCERT AT THE PARLIAMENT OF INDIA. WAS THE FIRST ORGANISATION TO SHED LIGHT ON THE NEED TO PRESERVE ENDANGERED INSTRUMENTS AND WAS SUPPORTED BY APJ ABDUL KALAM WHO OPENED THE EXHIBITION SHOWCASING THE SAME. APPOINTED BY NATIONAL IMPLEMENTATION COMMITTE TO ORGANISE BISMILLAH KHANS CENTENARY CONCERTS. HAS STARTED ITS EFFORTS TO BUILD SANGEET GRAM MUSIC VILLAGE IN VARANASI TO PROMOTE ENDANGERED INSTRUMENTS AND GHARANAS.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: I have made various efforts to preserve and promote Endangered Instruments of India and have been supported in this cause by Hon. Dr. A.P.J Abdul Kalam,Shri Naushad Ali. A three-day festival, Parampara, presented Indian Classical music in a way which is more appealing to the younger generation and the modern day audience. I tried to promote the endangered instruments and styles of performing by giving a platform to the very few artistes who play them.
Organised Fusion Harmony Concert at Fiji National University Fiji where Dr Soma Ghosh was a visiting professor of Music. Organised in collaboration with FNU.
To showcase and promote the endangered artform of typical ghazal singing and showcase the traditional darbari mehfils. As a tribute to Meena Kumari, her Nazms and Ghazals were sung.
To recreate courtesan scenes complete with a Shayar Nawab and a Kathak Dancer, to promote and preserve our heritage and tradition.

Celebrating Bharat Ratna Ust Bismillah Khans Centenary Celebrations, Madhu Murchhana was given the responsibilty of organising Yaad e Bismillah concerts infour cities of India, and abroad. A total of seven Yaad e Bismillahs were held at CCI Mumbai, Ghadge Hall Lucknow, Raj Bhawan Lucknow, Nehru Centre Mumbai, Poona Club Pune, Taj Falaknuma Palace Hyderabad, Karnavati Club Ahmedabad to celebrate the shehnai legends genius which included screening of the film on his life, shehnai recitals etc
